revision.text: ==English== ===Etymology=== {{suffix|en|Yangtze|an}} ===Adjective=== {{en-adj|-}} # Of or pertaining to the [[Yangtze]] [[river]]. #* '''1988''', Lyman P. Van Slyke, ''Yangtze: Nature, History, and the River'', Addison-Wesley Publishing Co. (1988), {{ISBN|0201088940}}, [http://books.google.com/books?id=oxZxAAAAMAAJ&q=%22yangtzean%22&redir_esc=y page 3]: #*: Natural time, social time, remembered time — these are the three kinds of time, the three lenses, through which I will try to view the '''Yangtzean''' world. #* '''1990''', ''Palaeontologia Cathayana'', Volume 5, [http://books.google.com/books?id=rn8fAQAAIAAJ&q=%22yangtzean%22 page 173]: #*: In China, the '''Yangtzean''' (or North China) fauna is equivalent to the shelf biofacies including endemic polymeroid ptychoparioids, corynexochids, redlichiids, etc., {{…}} #* '''2001''', Stephen J. Pyne, ''Fire: A Brief History'', University of Washington Press (2001), {{ISBN|9780714127620}}, [http://books.google.com/books?id=AOUvDp89rioC&pg=PA68&dq=%22yangtzean%22# page 68]: #*: Excepting some outliers — true wildlands, or the Nilotic, Mesopotamian, '''Yangtzean''' floodplains — fire and field came to share a mutual geography.
